subject:
Re: [Ip-health] Rep. Waxman Sends Letter to USTR Urging
 Reexamination of Thailand Decision
body:
Sarah and all,

  We have sent out a letter to Congressman Waxman thanking
him for his letter to the USTR regarding the reexamination
of Thialand being put on the watch list.

-----Original Message-----
>From: Sarah Rimmington 
>Sent: Jun 20, 2007 10:34 AM
>To: Ip-health@lists.essential.org
>Subject: [Ip-health] Rep. Waxman Sends Letter to USTR Urging Reexamination of Thailand Decision
>
>Begin forwarded message:
>
>
>June 20, 2007
>
>Rep. Waxman and 34 colleagues urge the U.S. Trade Representative to
>reexamine the Administration's decision to put Thailand on a \u201cPriority
>Watch List\u201d because of steps taken by the Thai government to secure
>generic versions of three drugs for citizens in its public health
>program. In the letter, the members call on the USTR to affirm the
>rights of countries to use the public health flexibilities recognized in
>international trade law.
>
>/ /
>
>The complete letter is available at http://www.house.gov/waxman/ or
>http://www.house.gov/waxman/pdfs/thailand%20letter%20to%20ustr%2006-20-07.pdf
>
>
>*/ /*
>
>*/Zahava Goldman/*
>
>*/Senior Legislative Aide/*
>
>*/Rep. Henry A. Waxman/*
>
>*/2204 Rayburn Building/*
>
>*/Phone: 202-225-3976 Fax: 202-225-4099/*
>
>*/District Office: 323-651-1040/*
>
>
>--
>Sarah Rimmington
>Project Attorney
>Essential Action, Access to Medicines Project
>Washington, DC
>Office: (202) 387-8030 x34
>Mobile: (202) 422-2687
>www.essentialaction.org/access
>
>_______________________________________________
>Ip-health mailing list
>Ip-health@lists.essential.org
>http://lists.essential.org/mailman/listinfo/ip-health
Regards,
Jeffrey A. Williams
Spokesman for INEGroup LLA. - (Over 134k members/stakeholders strong!)
"Obedience of the law is the greatest freedom" -
   Abraham Lincoln

"Credit should go with the performance of duty and not with what is very
often the accident of glory" - Theodore Roosevelt

"If the probability be called P; the injury, L; and the burden, B; liability
depends upon whether B is less than L multiplied by
P: i.e., whether B is less than PL."
United States v. Carroll Towing  (159 F.2d 169 [2d Cir. 1947]
